meanings.definition: To make something superficially attractive or acceptable.
meanings.sent1: She tried cosmeticizing her resume to impress the employer.
meanings.sent2: The company was accused of cosmeticizing their financial reports to hide losses.
meanings.sent3: He thought cosmeticizing the old car with a fresh coat of paint would make it run better.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises were just cosmeticizing the real issues at hand.
meanings.sent5: The magician was skilled at cosmeticizing his tricks to appear more impressive.

meanings.definition: The act of applying makeup or other beauty products to enhance one's appearance.
meanings.sent1: Her cosmeticizing routine included foundation, mascara, and lipstick.
meanings.sent2: Cosmeticizing can boost confidence by highlighting natural features.
meanings.sent3: The clown's exaggerated cosmeticizing made everyone laugh at the circus.
meanings.sent4: In the theater, cosmeticizing transforms actors into different characters.
meanings.sent5: The beauty vlogger's cosmeticizing tips helped viewers achieve a flawless look.
